unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi reports a 15% increase in neurology cases this month, especially among the 30-45 age group. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Head of Neurology, attributes this rise to increased stress levels and lifestyle changes. Common symptoms reported include persistent headaches, dizziness, and numbness in the extremities.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi reports a fifteen percent increase in neurology cases this month, especially among the thirty to forty five age group. Doctor Rajesh Kumar, Head of Neurology, attributes this rise to increased stress levels and lifestyle changes. Common symptoms reported include persistent headaches, dizziness, and numbness in the extremities.

unnormalised: Specialists are recommending timely consultation for early diagnosis and management of neurological disorders. An EEG costs approx. Rs. 2500 at most private hospitals, while a consultation fee with a senior neurologist can range from Rs. 1000-Rs. 3000. The hospital is also seeing a rise in stroke cases, particularly during the peak summer months of May-June.
normalised: Specialists are recommending timely consultation for early diagnosis and management of neurological disorders. An E-E-G costs approximately rupee two thousand five hundred at most private hospitals, while a consultation fee with a senior neurologist can range from rupee one thousand to rupee three thousand. The hospital is also seeing a rise in stroke cases, particularly during the peak summer months of May-June.

unnormalised: New treatments are available for conditions like epilepsy and Parkinson's disease, offering improved quality of life for patients. Medications such as Levetiracetam 500mg are frequently prescribed for seizure control. Remember, early intervention can significantly impact the progression of neurological ailments.
normalised: New treatments are available for conditions like epilepsy and Parkinson's disease, offering improved quality of life for patients. Medications such as Levetiracetam five hundred milligram are frequently prescribed for seizure control. Remember, early intervention can significantly impact the progression of neurological ailments.

unnormalised: AIIMS is also conducting a free neurology camp on 28/07/2024, from 9 AM to 4 PM. This aims to provide free consultations and diagnostic tests to the underprivileged sections of society. Those experiencing any neurological symptoms are encouraged to attend.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S is also conducting a free neurology camp on twenty eighth July two thousand and twenty four, from nine A-M to four P-M. This aims to provide free consultations and diagnostic tests to the underprivileged sections of society. Those experiencing any neurological symptoms are encouraged to attend.
